rpki-client Portable Release

rpki-client 9.4 portable: released Jan 7th, 2025

The portable version of rpki-client adds support for other Unix flavors by adding autotool support and the necessary compatibility layer. It borrows heavily from the OpenSSH and LibreSSL portable projects.

The more of these interfaces that are implemented natively by an operating system, the higher the chance a portable version will just work. If your operating system is unsupported, encourage your OS vendor to support these secure and simple APIs.

rpki-client works on all operating systems with a libcrypto library based on OpenSSL 1.1 or LibreSSL 3.6, a libtls library compatible with LibreSSL 3.6 or later, and zlib.

At the time of writing, rpki-client portable is known to build and work on:

  • OpenBSD
  • FreeBSD
  • Linux
  • macOS

rpki-client may work on other operating systems. Reports (success or otherwise are welcome. You may report bugs or submit pull requests at the GitHub project.

Signing

Releases are signed with GPG using this public key (B5B6416FEA6DDA05EA562A9FCB987F2783972FF9),
or with the signify key RWQyprfgXLzkG4YOlzFYl/4nbuLUtmjAFItNrkc4dNVPV6ma5Vbmb1O8.
